availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jackson H. Jacobs (Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer and captain)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Jane Jacobs. Father of Henry C. Jacobs, Martha Jacobs, Isabella Jacobs, John C. Jacobs, William M. Jacobs, Marian Jacobs, and Francis Jacobs. Collier in Greenup County in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed Robert Burgess in Greenup County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a captain from February 13, 1863 to March 24, 1864. Served in the Sandy Valley Battalion of the 1st Regiment Capital Guards (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from August 1, 1864 to March 11, 1865.
